IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Thursday the 13" day of February, 2025./ 24" Magha, 1946.
CCG. 551/2021
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poonthura
Police Station in Crime No. 1404/2021.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused - Prasad, aged 38 years, S/o. Josaphath, Thyvilakom Purayidam,
TC. 75/1253(1), Balan Nagar, Poonthura Ward, Muttathara
Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Sandeep. A.S)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b), 323 and 324 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused is found not guilty of offences punishable under
sections 294(b), 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and he
is acquitted of the said offences under section 248(1) Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stand cancelled and he
is set at liberty.
Description of accused
Josaphath Muttathara Village | Thiruvananthapuram

This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b), 323 and
324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the prior enmity on
19.08.2023, at 20.30 hours, the accused uttered obscene words against CW1 at
Cheriyamuttam -— Beach Lane, Poonthura Ward, Muttathara Village.
Thereafter the accused struck on his forehead and both knees with a jacky
lever, resulting in injury. Thus accused committed offences punishable under
sections 294(b), 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police
Poonthura police station and the case was taken on file as CC.551/2021.
Cognizance was taken for the offences punishable w/ss. 294(b), 323 and 324 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the accused.

3 of 5

4. On appearance of the accused, he was enlarged on bail on 21.08.2021. Copies
of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to him under section 207
Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution and counsel for
accused charge framed for offences u/ss. 294(b), 323 and 324 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860, read over and explained to the accused to which he pleaded not
guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Ext. P1 was marked. As
the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW6. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused questioning of the accused
under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with.
Accused was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was
adduced from the side of the accused.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 19.08.2023, at 20.30 hours, at Cheriyamuttam — Beach Lane,
Poonthura Ward, Muttathara Village, the accused uttered obscene words
towards PW1, which is in or near the public place and thereby committed
an offence punishable under section 294(b) of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

4o0f5

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place, the accused voluntarily
caused hurt to PW1 and thereby accused committed an offence punishable
u/s. 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(3) Whether on the same day, at same time and place, the accused struck on
PW1’s forehead and both knees with a jacky lever and thereby accused
committed an offence punishable w/s. 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(4) If the accused is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 3 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point numbers 1 to 3
are considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed
offences punishable under sections 294(b), 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code,
1860.

9. PW1 admitted his signature in the Ext. P1 statement. According to PW1, the
accused has assaulted him and he has no grievance against the accused.

10. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up CW2 to CW6 and she is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused. For the said reason
these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 4 :- Upon the finding in point nos. 1 to 3,. the accused is found not
guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b), 323 and 324 of Indian

5 of 5

Penal Code, 1860 and he is acquitted for the said offences under section

248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stand cancelled and

he is set at liberty.

The Jacky lever was produced before this court as T No. 251/2021 will be

destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 13" day of February, 2025.

Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
